Replying to a Topic or Response

After someone starts a topic, you can reply to the topic or to one or more of its responses.

To respond to a topic or response:

  1. From the topic tree or list, select the item to which you are responding.

  2. Select Respond on the Topic menu or context menu. The New Topic dialog opens.

  3. On the Topic tab, enter the title of your response in the Title text box.

  4. Enter your remarks in the Content text box.

  5. (Optional) Select the Options tab if you want to send the response to specific team members, assign a priority to the response, or indicate a status for the response.

    1. To send a response to specific team members, click Add. The Select Topic Recipients dialog opens.

    2. Select the team members from the list, then click Add.

    3. Click OK to return to the New Topic dialog.

    4. To assign a priority to the response, select Low, Normal, or High from the Priority drop-down list box.

    5. To specify a response status, select either Active or Closed from the drop-down list box. The default status is Active.

  6. (Optional) If your company purchased the application's repository customization feature, your administrator may have created additional properties. If this is the case, select the Custom tab.

    1. Double-click the name of a custom property. The Edit Property dialog opens.

    2. Select a new value for this property. For integer, text, and real fields, Value is a text box. For enumerated types and user IDs, it is a list box. For dates and times, Value has a date check box and a time check box, each of which is followed by a date or time in the format for your locale.

    3. Repeat steps a and b for other custom properties.

  7. (Optional) Select the Attachments tab if you want to attach a file or graphic with your response.

    1. Click Add. The Open dialog displays.

    2. Enter the attachment name in the File Name text box.

    3. Click Open.

    4. Repeat the previous steps for additional attachments.

  8. (Optional) Select the Comment tab to add additional notes or a comment in the Comment For New Revision text box.

  9. When the information is complete, click OK. This action displays the response in the upper pane.

    10. If the tree format is selected, the response appears in relation to other parts of the threaded conversation. The response title, your user name, and the time stamp also display. If the list format is selected, the list displays the same information, but includes one additional column, Description, which shows the first few words in the response text.
